phrases.text: Hò hò đưa linh hưm hư hứ

culturalContext.description: Funeral procession song with ritual vocables, used when escorting the deceased's spirit
facts: Đưa linh means 'escort the spirit' in funeral context
Vocables (hưm hư hứ) create solemn, ritualistic atmosphere
culturalContext.musicalContext: Solemn opening with slow, deliberate rhythm

phrases.text: A đưa linh ơ phản ơ hồi

culturalContext.description: Continuation of ritual call with additional vocables marking the procession
facts: Ơ phản ơ hồi are traditional vocables in funeral songs
culturalContext.musicalContext: Repeated melodic pattern with slight variation

phrases.text: Ai đem chiếc ư thuyền loan qua bể
phrases.english: Who brought the spirit boat across the sea?

culturalContext.description: Metaphor for the soul's journey across the sea of death to the afterlife
facts: Thuyền loan (spirit boat) transports souls in Vietnamese belief
Bể (sea) represents the boundary between life and death
Question format invites reflection on mortality

phrases.text: Bắc ư ơ ơ ư không ơ cho

culturalContext.description: Instruction about anchoring or placing the spirit boat, with many ritual vocables
facts: Bắc can mean to anchor or to lay down ritually
Heavy use of vocables indicates sacred/ritual nature
culturalContext.musicalContext: Transitional phrase with sustained notes on vocables

phrases.text: a chim nhạn đậu ư chốn ơ non ơ đoài
phrases.english: Ah, the swallow perches at the distant mountain place

culturalContext.description: Bird imagery symbolizes the departed soul finding rest in the afterlife mountains
facts: Chim nhạn (swallow) symbolizes souls in Vietnamese funeral poetry
Mountains (non) represent the spirit realm or paradise
đoài suggests distance, the separation between living and dead
culturalContext.musicalContext: Closing phrase with gentle, descending melody suggesting rest/peace
